reviewText:
Welcome to Squirt‚Äôs Adventure,


Where all the dangerous wet things happen!



You are now an octopus, the most unknown octopus named squirt of the world.
A smelly dirty piece of fishy meat with a lot of tentacle around you, recently born, you are now discovering the real life of a busy wet beach. The risk of traveling from a busy island to another is huge.


No matter who you are, how smelly you are you want and WILL be the biggest and the most popular squirter of Squirt‚Äôs Adventure.

You shall face the adversity of the ocean and fishs, the ones that zig-zag, the ones that don‚Äôt remember where he come from, the ones that sleep. ‚Äì Oh and, just saying, you‚Äôll be the one that won‚Äôt remember where he come from too, say thanks to the best octopus AI system inside a squirt simulator you‚Äôll ever see, so good it will make you reconsider to have a regular sleeping schedule to avoid going limp at the most important moments in the ocean‚Äì so make sure you take use of those tentacles to travel faster and avoid being ate.

At start you will be small, mildly menacing and rusty at start, but don‚Äôt worry, the more you discover yourself, the more you‚Äôll be able to do bigger jump, being evil ‚Äì Literally ‚Äì and having friends and discovering some awesome fountains.

But that isn‚Äôt going to be done without any harm. As squirt, you‚Äôll get crushed, pounded by massive sharks and much more. A life for squirt is a busy life.

You‚Äôll start as a exhausted smelly octopus, who have literally no capacity to do anything. You‚Äôll fall on the back numerous times until you find the perfect balance on your tentacles.

You always have to start somewhere huh?

You‚Äôll slowly but surely becoming skilled enough to be a powerful octopus, an octopus that will be probably the most hated octopus of Squirt‚Äôs Adventure, but you‚Äôll become THE ONE. Able to do everything you want without any time limit. Opening your inner self to discover more adventures? CHECK! Getting your tongue stuck between your tooth by learning some words CHECK! ‚Äì The Waterer Watered huh? ‚Äì, every occasion is good to learn.

You‚Äôll slowly go up in the food chain, to become the most powerful octopus Squirt‚Äôs Adventure ever seen.

This game is more than a simple squirt simulator. It will get you very emotional. You will have to take heartbreaking choice ‚Äì should you take this detour just to face some complicated words and popping wrong bubbles and deceive yourself by obtaining another words you didn‚Äôt wanted to‚Äì this game is going to be tough on your mind, but very enjoyable on the outcome.

This is the most deep and biggest words learning you will ever play in your entire life.
You will get the feeling to cosplay as squirt and going out in town, and you will never see your environment the same way after, you will have enough experience to know the danger of the ocean, fountains and much more.


Sadly, Squirt is the only selectable character, but there‚Äôs various unlock INCLUDING HATS!


You are Squirt, have a happy journey in Squirt‚Äôs Adventure and be ready for the adventure of a life!

reviewText: My 3 year old son enjoys this game. I write out the names of the objects in the bubbles to help him understand what letter each of the words starts with. He knows his alphabet and the sounds they make and this is a fun way to help him learn about spelling.
voteText: 11 of 13 people (85%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This isn't a bad game, but it's not that good either. I'm not sure it was worth the price I paid. It is a little simple, but at times too complicated too. The first level the bubbles come up at a normal speed, and increase as the level(s) progress. My youngest was having a difficult time identifying the objects as the speed picked up. The concept of using the coins to buy stuff is over their heads too, and also not very rewarding. The cost of the items is too high, for something like an eye patch or facial hair for the characters, it seemed a little pointless. The voice/audio track wasn't great either. Not with the words or goofy sayings, but poor quality. Seems like this concept would have been better as an app for the iPad or something.\n\nI don't mean to be discouraging since this appears to be one of the first flat out educational games Steam offers, and I especially don't mean to be negative towards the people that put time and effort into the game, but the price is not worth the end product. Even the sale price is too steep. There are lower priced educational apps out there that offer more and better content.
